text: AHH This makese sense
<@U02FEFUH8RE> Niraj has a great platform called pandaflow that is really useful when setting up syncs between platforms

Hi, I was reading this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline>
And I was confused by two things:
• why the templates API works only with the API key, which will be deprecated soon?
• why aren't templates compatible with private apps?
• why should I use a public app for timeline events, isn't a private app with its own access token enough?

1. This api works with Developer API Keys not HapiKeys. Developers API keys aren't being deprecated yet. Attached is image for where you can find your api key
2. I don't know CC. <@U9SDG59T7> Looks like there another person that would like to see timeline events for private apps.
3. Again this just isn't a feature yet. Mark what are your thoughts here. Is the best way to work around this for the time being still to marry a private and "public app"?

Thank you!
Personally I find it weird that I have to use a public app if I simply need to add some timeline events to a deal or contact. I was quite sure that I could do everything with the access token I already use to read, edit and manage deals and contacts.
Yeah, I've also ran into the same issue

Hi, yes unfortunately that’s right. Today, timeline events can only be set up + triggered from apps created in app developer accounts (“public” or “oauth” apps). Private apps don’t currently support them.

Thank you for the answer!
I think it would be nice to have private apps support timelines!
HubSpot support confirmed for me that HubSpot doesn’t currently have a Sales Document API. Does anyone have a suggestion of a workaround?
What are you trying to do?
Upload pdfs into the Sales Document from a Meteor app.
Technically there is an api: <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/presentations/v1/deck/upload>
It's just internal

The endpoint does require a
```x-HubSpot-csrf-HubSpotapi```
And also a cookie

Hi team, I am looking to get statistics of emails by month via API. I see there is an endpoint for this - <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing-emails/v1/emails/with-statistics?hapikey={{hapikey}}> but it provides no way to filter the statistics based on a date range. Anyone know of how can I extract statistics for emails via a date range?
yeah… they must not be handling that properly. not your fault. :stuck_out_tongue:

hi, guys!!
how can I *get* the *notes* from a contact? is it a contact property?
thank you!!
actually.. it is a separated API, just found it
Should be the engagements api, correct?
just reached this one: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/notes>
that is almost my first time with HubSpot.. I'm enjoying it, seems to be amazing
Awesome! Glad to hear. There are some that are better than others!

we'll start getting the notes from the contacts... do you know if there's a way of getting only the last modified ones? to avoid always getting all of them?

I'll start researching for it, anyway
